private_information: I am one of two agents manipulating the blocks.
I executed the first half of the action sequence (actions 1 to 15).
I can move only the top block of a stack and carry only one block at a time.
robot1.goal: Follow the given action sequence and report the actions I executed and the observed initial configuration.

private_information: I am one of two agents manipulating the blocks.
I executed the second half of the action sequence (actions 16 to 30).
I can move only the top block of a stack and carry only one block at a time.
robot2.goal: Follow the given action sequence and report the actions I executed and the observed initial configuration.

private_information: I coordinate the information reported by both robots and must produce a final PDDL domain and problem for a FastDownwards planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the reports from the two robots and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that represents the final blocks arrangement.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World with blocks A B C D E F G H I J and a single table surface.
Only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.

Initial configuration: A is on the table, B is on the table, C is on top of I, D is on top of J, E is on top of F, F is on top of B, G is on top of D, H is on top of G, I is on top of A, J is on top of C.
The agents execute a fixed sequence of 30 actions which involves unstack, stack, putdown and pickup operations.

report.system_prompt: You are robot1. Report the initial observed blocks configuration and provide the list of actions you executed (actions 1 to 15) exactly as given. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is robot1. You observed the public information {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information {agents->robot1->private_information}. Provide a clear report that contains the initial configuration you observed and the ordered list of actions you executed. Output should be suitable for the orchestrator to consume.

report.system_prompt: You are robot2. Report the initial observed blocks configuration and provide the list of actions you executed (actions 16 to 30) exactly as given. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is robot2. You observed the public information {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information {agents->robot2->private_information}. Provide a clear report that contains the initial configuration you observed and the ordered list of actions you executed. Output should be suitable for the orchestrator to consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the reports from both robots and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file representing the Blocks World instance after executing the provided action sequence. Target the FastDownwards planner when producing the problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the reports from both agents that describe the initial configuration and the actions they executed. Use those reports to derive the final arrangement of the blocks and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep the actions of different agents distinct in your reasoning but emit a single coherent PDDL domain and problem that captures the final state. The agents reports are: {seq_robot1} and {seq_robot2}. The public info is {environment->public_information}. The orchestrator goal is {agents->orchestrator->goal}.
